db:abstract.db:para: An interface for camera settings related to focus and zoom.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The Camera element can be used within a CaptureSession for video recording and image taking.
You can use MediaDevices to list available cameras and choose which one to use.

On hardware that supports it, QCamera lets you adjust the focus and zoom. This also includes functionality such as a "Macro" mode for close up work (e.g. reading barcodes, or recognizing letters), or "touch to focus" - indicating an interesting area of the image for the hardware to attempt to focus on.
The minimumZoomFactor and maximumZoomFactor properties provide the range of supported zoom factors. The zoomFactor property allows changing the zoom factor.

After capturing the raw data for a camera frame, the camera hardware and software performs various image processing tasks to produce the final image. This includes compensating for ambient light color, reducing noise, as well as making some other adjustments to the image.
You can control many of these processing steps through the Camera properties. For example, you can set the white balance (or color temperature) used for processing images:
For more information on image processing of camera frames, see Camera Image Processing.
See the camera overview for more information.

db:section.db:title: active : bool
db:section.db:para: Describes whether the camera is currently active.

db:section.db:title: cameraDevice : cameraDevice
db:section.db:para: Gets or sets the currently active camera device.

db:section.db:title: cameraFormat : cameraFormat
db:section.db:para: Gets or sets the currently active camera format.

db:section.db:title: customFocusPoint : point
db:section.db:para: This property holds the position of custom focus point, in relative frame coordinates. This means that QPointF(0,0) points to the top-left corner of the frame, and QPointF(0.5,0.5) points to the center of the frame.
Custom focus point is used only in FocusPointCustom focus mode.
You can check whether custom focus points are supported by querying supportedFeatures() with the Feature.CustomFocusPoint flag.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] error : enumeration
db:section.db:para: Returns the error state of the camera.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] errorString : string
db:section.db:para: Returns a human readable string describing a camera's error state.

db:section.db:title: exposureCompensation : real
db:section.db:para: Gets or sets the exposure compensation in EV units.
Exposure compensation property allows to adjust the automatically calculated exposure.

db:section.db:title: exposureMode : ExposureMode
db:section.db:para: The exposure mode being used.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] exposureTime : float
db:section.db:para: Returns the Camera's exposure time in seconds.

db:section.db:title: flashMode : enumeration
db:section.db:para: Gets or sets a certain flash mode if the camera has a flash.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] flashReady : bool
db:section.db:para: Indicates if the flash is charged and ready to use.

db:section.db:title: focusDistance : float
db:section.db:para: This property return an approximate focus distance of the camera. The value reported is between 0 and 1, 0 being the closest possible focus distance, 1 being as far away as possible. Note that 1 is often, but not always infinity.
Setting the focus distance will be ignored unless the focus mode is set to FocusModeManual.

db:section.db:title: focusMode : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the current camera focus mode.

db:note.db:para: In automatic focusing modes and where supported, the focusPoint property provides information and control over the area of the image that is being focused.

db:td.db:para: Continuous auto focus, preferring objects near to the camera.
Continuous auto focus, preferring objects far away from the camera.
Focus to hyperfocal distance, with the maximum depth of field achieved. All objects at distances from half of this distance out to infinity will be acceptably sharp.

db:section.db:para: If a certain focus mode is not supported, setting it will have no effect.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] focusPoint : point
db:section.db:para: Returns the point currently used by the auto focus system to focus onto.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] isoSensitivity : int
db:section.db:para: Describes the ISO sensitivity currently used by the camera.

db:section.db:title: manualExposureTime : real
db:section.db:para: Gets or sets a manual exposure time.
Setting this property to -1 (the default) means that the camera automatically determines the exposure time.

db:section.db:title: manualIsoSensitivity : int
db:section.db:para: Describes a manually set ISO sensitivity
Setting this property to -1 (the default), implies that the camera automatically adjusts the ISO sensitivity.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] maximumZoomFactor : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the maximum zoom factor supported.
This will be 1.0 on cameras that do not support zooming.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] minimumZoomFactor : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the minimum zoom factor supported.
This will be 1.0 on cameras that do not support zooming.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] supportedFeatures : Features
db:section.db:para: Returns the features supported by this camera.

db:section.db:title: torchMode : Camera::TorchMode
db:section.db:para: Gets or sets the torch mode being used.
A torch is a continuous source of light. It can be used during video recording in low light conditions. Enabling torch mode will usually override any currently set flash mode.

db:section.db:title: whiteBalanceMode : WhiteBalanceMode
db:section.db:para: Gets or sets the white balance mode being used.

db:section.db:title: zoomFactor : real
db:section.db:para: Gets or sets the current zoom factor. Values will be clamped between minimumZoomFactor and maximumZoomFactor.

db:section.db:title: void errorOccurred(Camera::Error error, string errorString)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when error state changes to error. A description of the error is provided as errorString.

db:section.db:title: colorTemperature()
db:section.db:para: Gets or sets the current color temperature.

Setting a color temperature will only have an effect if WhiteBalanceManual is supported. In this case, setting a temperature greater 0 will automatically set the white balance mode to WhiteBalanceManual. Setting the temperature to 0 will reset the white balance mode to WhiteBalanceAuto.

db:section.db:title: bool isExposureModeSupported(ExposureMode mode)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the exposure mode is supported.

db:section.db:title: bool isFlashModeSupported(FlashMode mode)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the flash mode is supported.

db:section.db:title: bool isFlashReady()
db:section.db:para: Returns true if flash is charged.

db:section.db:title: bool isFocusModeSupported(FocusMode mode)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the focus mode is supported by the camera.

db:section.db:title: bool isTorchModeSupported(TorchMode mode)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the torch mode is supported.

db:section.db:title: bool isWhiteBalanceModeSupported(WhiteBalanceMode mode)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the white balance mode is supported.

db:section.db:title: void start()
db:section.db:para: Starts the camera.
Same as setting the active property to true.
If the camera can't be started for some reason, the errorOccurred() signal is emitted.

db:section.db:title: void stop()
db:section.db:para: Stops the camera. Same as setting the active property to false.

db:section.db:title: void zoomTo(factor, rate)
db:section.db:para: Zooms to a zoom factor factor using rate.
The rate is specified in powers of two per second. At a rate of 1 it would take 2 seconds to go from a zoom factor of 1 to 4.

db:note.db:para: Using a specific rate is not supported on all cameras. If not supported, zooming will happen as fast as possible.
